answers.answer: Only a doctor can diagnose your health problems. You have multiple health issues which makes your health status difficult to diagnose.Please see a gastroenterologist or a hepatologist to assess your hepatitis and liver disease issues.A high WBC count usually means you have an underlying medical problem. We don't have enough medical information about you to draw any intelligent conclusions.High white blood cell count could indicate• Infection• Inflammation• Trauma• Tissue damage (from burns)• Use of certain medications, such as corticosteroids, antibiotics or anti-seizure drugs• Allergy• Chronic bone marrow diseases such as a myeloproliferative disorder• Acute or chronic leukemia• Diverticular Disease• Intense exercise• Severe physical or emotional stressGood luck.Hector
It just means your liver is having to work harder to do it's job.

Hello, while your blood counts can bounce around; the important thing to find out is how much damage has been done to  your liverHave you had a biopsy?  My liver enzymes were similar to yours so it was thought that I did not have much damage and could afford to wait to treatAfter the biopsy I was told my blood work did not indicated the severity of the damage to my liver.  The biopsy indicated possible transition to cirrhosis I was told I needed to treat right away.I hope you can find out more informationGood luck

question: i had bloodwork done yesterday and my wbc was 15000 and my ast 80 and my alt was111 .i have diabetes a fatty liver and hepatitis c was do these elaveted levels mean?
title: high alt and ast
